alert.note: Alert for Davidson; Sumner; Williamson; Wilson (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 03 at 7:00AM CST by NWS Nashville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of eastern Davidson, southwestern Sumner, northeastern Williamson and northwestern Wilson Counties through 730 AM CST... At 700 AM CST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Oak Hill, or near Nashville, moving northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Franklin, Gallatin, Lebanon, Nashville, Madison, Hendersonville, Brentwood, La Vergne, Mount Juliet, Goodlettsville, Nolensville, Forest Hills, Oak Hill, Belle Meade, Lakewood, Hermitage, Rural Hill, Antioch, Belinda City and Old Hickory. This includes the following highways... Interstate 40 between mile markers 206 and 234. Interstate 65 between mile markers 68 and 88, and between mile markers 90 and 91. Interstate 24 between mile markers 47 and 63. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 1100 AM CST for Middle Tennessee.
